intro: Tapura amazonica var. typica, commonly known as the Amazonian tapura, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
